title: Michel de Montaigne
summary: Michel Eyquem de Montaigne (/mɒnˈteɪn/ mon-TAYN;[6] French: [miʃɛl ekɛm də mɔ̃tɛɲ]; 28 February 1533 – 13 September 1592[7]), also known as Lord of Montaigne, was one of the most significant philosophers of the French Renaissance. He is known for popularizing the essay as a literary genre. His work is noted for its merging of casual anecdotes[8] and autobiography with intellectual insight. His massive volume Essais contains some of the most influential essays ever written.
